intro: Taraxacum geirhildae, commonly known as the Geirhild's dandelion, is a flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is native to Iceland and is characterized by its yellow composite flowers and serrated leaves. The plant produces a distinctive, hollow stem that supports its flowering head. It thrives in moist, open habitats and is often found in grassy areas. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
